comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Maybe Margaret A. Carter?   In September 1913, a Mrs. Margaret A. Carter was in the news when she arrested on blackmail charges in Cleveland.    The story seems to be that she wrote to heiress Lillian Huntington asking for $3000 in exchange for leaving Huntington's fiance alone.  Carter went on a hunger strike when taken into custody, and collapsed while she was being transported to a hearing.
